data.title: Connect@First Newsletter
data.text:
GROW@FIRST STARTING SOON!

We are excited to resume our weekly Bible Study and Discipleship opportunities on Wednesday, September 4. This fall, our prayer is that you will find ways to grow and mature in your faith and in community with others at First Pres. The brochure will be available soon in the information racks and at FirstPresGreenville.org.

DISCOVER FIRST: NEW MEMBER WEEKEND

Are you interested in making First Presbyterian your church home? Discover more about the vision, discipleship, and outreach of FPC! New Member Weekend will be Friday−Saturday, September 6-7. Childcare is available for children age 5 and under. For details, contact Linda Sholtis (lsholtis@firstpresgreenville.org). Register at FirstPresGreenville.org/Events.

2025 TRIPS TO SCOTLAND AND EUROPE

Join Dr. Richard Gibbons and Lindsay Graham June 11-18, 2025, for a Tour of Scotland. Price includes round trip airfare from GSP, hotels, transportation, tickets, all breakfasts, two dinners, and gratuities. Contact Lindsay Graham at lgtravel@firstpresgreenville.org. Registration is now open at FirstPresGreenville.org/Events. Please join us on Sunday, September 8, at 6:00pm in the Abbott Gathering Space to hear more details about this trip and the upcoming trip to Europe (September 16-26, 2025).

BRUNCH BUNCH ON SUNDAYS

All singles and families are invited to gather Sunday afternoon for brunch at Ink and Ivy in downtown Greenville. Please meet at 12:15pm in front of the bookstore or just meet at the restaurant. No sign-ups, just show up and enjoy a meal together. Questions? Contact Stan Johnson at sjohnson@firstpresgreenville.org.

BALLET MAGNIFICAT STRATAGEM

Join Ballet Magnificat on October 25 at 6:30pm at First Pres as they put a new spin on the C.S. Lewis classic, The Screwtape Letters, with their most whimsical ballet to date, “Stratagem.” Experience the humor, athleticism, and drama of this internationally acclaimed company founded by Kathy Thibodeaux, silver medalist at the second USA International Ballet competition. Tickets available August 16, click here.

BOOK READING: BEAUTY IS OXYGEN

On Thursday, August 15, at 5:30pm in the FPC Student Program Space, Dr. Wesley VanderLugt will be sharing his new book, Beauty is Oxygen, with us! Come ready to be blessed by the way theology, spiritual formation, and art connect and converge in our everyday lives. RSVP to Chelsea Fraser at cfraser@firstpresgreenville.org if you have not already saved a seat. We hope to see you there!

QUILTED FAITH EXHIBIT COMING SOON

Quilted Faith: A Fiber Arts Exhibition by Christian artists will open September 5 with a reception, 6:00pm-8:00pm in The Galleries at First Presbyterian. This new exhibit is designed to embody the intricate, rich love of Christ as he “knit us together in love” (Colossians 2:2) with beauty and purpose. For details, contact Chelsea Fraser at cfraser@firstpresgreenville.org.

TENTH AVENUE NORTH:THE INVITED TOUR

FPC will welcome Tenth Avenue North: The Invited Tour on Friday, September 20, at 7:00pm, in the Worship & Arts Center. The group that brought you some of Christian music’s biggest anthems—Control (Somehow You Want Me), By Your Side, You Are More, Worn, I Have This Hope, and Healing Begins—is back and better than ever. Purchase tickets at FirstPresGreenville.org/Events or the new reception desk during regular business hours. Cashless payments only.

CHURCH LEAGUE BASKETBALL REGISTRATION

Church league basketball registration is now open until August 31. Late registration is September 1-15. Learn more details and sign up at FirstPresSports.com. Questions? Contact Caleb McKisic at caleb@firstpressports.com.

THE LIGHT OF CHRIST CONCERT WITH "ILLUMINARE"

Join us Sunday, September 15, at 3:00pm in the Sanctuary for a free concert presented by the FPC Church Choir and Orchestra. Celebrate the love and light of Christ through some of your favorite hymns, anthems, Scripture readings, and the brand new 5-movement work, “Illuminare,” by composer Elaine Hagenberg. Free tickets are now available, click here, and the reception desks.

JOIN THE EVENT VOLUNTEER TEAM!

Now is the time to transform the heart of the city with your welcoming smile and cheerful attitude by being a part of the Event Volunteer Team! Please come to one of the two training meetings for both new and existing volunteers on August 23 at 12:00noon or at 6:00pm in RoomD305. Click here to register. If you have questions, contact Linda Sholtis (lsholtis@firstpresgreenville.org).

VOLUNTEERS NEEDED AT HOLLIS ACADEMY

We need people willing to meet at the church two Mondays/month in the morning to help pack weekend food bags for 110 Hollis students. Please contact Emily Moore (em9600@aol.com) to volunteer.

The Good News Club is also looking for volunteers to teach young children about the Lord after school on Tuesdays. If interested, please contact Cindy Griner (cindy@cefgreenville.com).
